me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.utils

Class Joystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.utils.Joystick

  • public class Joystick
extends java.lang.Object
    A two-axis joystick. This joystick has two axes - an X axis and a Y axis.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Joystick(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double> xAxis, java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double> yAxis)
      Create a new Joystick with the default deadzone of 0.05.
      Joystick(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double> xAxis, java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double> yAxis, double deadzone)
      Create a new Joystick.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Angle getAngle()
      Get the angle formed by the X and Y axes.
      double getMagnitude()
      Get the magnitude of the joystick input.
      PointXY getPoint()
      Get a point in the form of (x, y), where x and y are joystick axis values.

      Get the joystick's X value.

        Create a new Joystick with the default deadzone of 0.05.

        yAxis - the Y axis supplier.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Get the joystick's X value.
        Returns:
        the joystick's X value.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Get the joystick's Y value.
        Returns:
        the joystick's Y value.

      • getPoint

        public PointXY getPoint()
        Get a point in the form of (x, y), where x and y are joystick axis values.
        Returns:
        a PointXY representation of the joystick's state.

      • getMagnitude

        public double getMagnitude()
        Get the magnitude of the joystick input. This is determined by getting the distance between (0, 0) and (x, y).
        Returns:
        the magnitude of the joystick input.

      • getAngle

        public Angle getAngle()
        Get the angle formed by the X and Y axes. This angle is determined by looking at the angle between (0, 0) and (x, y).
        Returns:
        the angle formed by the X and Y axes.

      • isNonZeroX

        public boolean isNonZeroX()
        Does the X axis have a non-zero value?
        Returns:
        true if the X axis has a non-zero value; false otherwise.

      • isNonZeroY

        public boolean isNonZeroY()
        Does the Y axis have a non-zero value?
        Returns:
        true if the Y axis has a non-zero value; false otherwise.

      • isNonZero

        public boolean isNonZero()
        Do either of the axes have a non-zero value?
        Returns:
        true if X or Y has a non-zero value; false otherwise.
